sourcesContent:
import React from "react"; const About = () => { return (

Hi Im Blank, and welcome again to my portfolio

This is my final Portfolio, the culmination of all of my projects in Brown CSCI1300: User Interface and User Experience. This page shows the developlemnt of my front-end skills. From utilizing hierarchy, to emphasising learnability and usuablity. This page features projects that utilize HTML, CSS, design skills, and even CSS. Hope you enjoy and learn something along the way!



Here's a brief overview of the four projects in this portfolio:

Personas and Storyboarding

The first portfolio is Personas and Storyboarding. This is a fundamental concepts of design, in which we can use to determine and improve upon user experience. With the knowledge of personas that would use our interface, be it a real object or a webpage, we can cater our design and functionality to that of our users. Additionally, having a storyboard helps to determine how usuable, learnable, and memorable our interfaces can be. This is a stepping stone to becoming a good webpage developer.

Responsive Redesign

Continuing along our journey to be web developers, we took a look at existing websites and we found places that it could be improve. Whether that was a small change in the hierarchy of the page, or a whole redesign. This is where we start putting our skills to practice.

Iterative Design

But what if we didn't have a template? We'd have to design the interface ourselves. Using a start-up to give us a purpose, we designed an app where we use our design techniques from the previous two projects and help a start-up achieve the goals of their ideas, putting our design skills to the test!

Development

Finally, we get to React. We get to work on a dynamic page, with animations and buttons with actual functionality. We use all of our abilities together to create a webpage. This gave us experience with React, as well as some freedom to design and implement functionality on our own terms.

); }; export default About;
